Je bent (bijna) in het bezit van een hbo of wo diploma en wil graag aan de slag binnen de IT, maar merkt dat de aansluiting op een specifieke baan nog beter zou kunnen. Je bent op zoek naar een IT-traineeship die jou de juiste tooling biedt en zorgt voor een vliegende start van jouw carrière! Nu nog één vinden die aan jouw wensen voldoet! Benieuwd of dat het traineeship van Working Talent is? Lees dan snel verder!
Hoe ziet het traineeship er uit?Op 29 maart 2021 gaat er weer een nieuw IT-traineeship van start. Dit traineeship bestaat uit 3 fases.
In fase 1 en 2 volg jij een intensief IT-bootcamp, dat bestaat uit klassikale trainingen en online zelfstudie. In fase 1 leg jij de basis van jouw IT-carrière. Je gaat gedurende 4 weken aan de slag met fundamentele IT-onderwerpen zoals Agile & Scrum, networking, architectuur, security, modelleren, coderen, databases en cloud. In fase 2, die 6 weken duurt, ga je een specialisatie doen. Er zijn 4 uitstroomrichtingen: Data Analytics, DevOps Cloud, Software Development en Business & IT. Samen besluiten wij welke specialisatie jij gaat doen.
In fase 3 ga jij aan de slag bij een van onze opdrachtgevers. Je stroomt in als trainee en wordt vanaf de start goed begeleid door collega’s, teamleden en Working Talent. Het uitgangspunt is dat je na ongeveer 1,5 jaar in dienst treedt bij jouw opdrachtgever.
Dit vragen wij van jouEen afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding (een IT- of bèta studie is een pré)Je bent initiatiefrijk, communicatief vaardig, analytisch en flexibel ingesteldJe hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met IT, bijvoorbeeld doordat je enige ervaring hebt met programmeren of het bouwen van je eigen website (zelfstudie inbegrepen).Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift
Dit bieden wij jouEen leerzaam en innovatief IT-traineeship waarin je leert werken met de nieuwste technieken die aansluiten bij de actualiteiten in de marktDiverse erkende certificatenGoede begeleiding door Working TalentEen startsalaris van € 2600 bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur, vanaf de eerste werkdag bij de opdrachtgeverEen startbonus van € 1400 bruto, na drie gewerkte maanden bij de opdrachtgever Deze vacature staat uit in meerdere regio's. Bekijk de andere vacatures of neem contact met ons op voor de mogelijkheden. Is dit traineeship echt iets voor jou? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw sollicitatie!
Voor vragen kun je kun je contact opnemen met één van onze recruiters via 085-0608506 of solliciteren@workingtalent.nl.

Working hours: Fulltime (32h-40h)
Location: Geldermalsen, the Netherlands

As an ambitious and technically focused company, we keep moving forward with innovation. We are looking for sharp minded and talented engineers who can help our R&D teams reach the next level, creating more and even better quality products.

Our new team members should have a very technical background.

Are you up for the challenge? Then, keep reading.

What will you be doing?

This Includes

As a Software Engineer, you will be working on one or more of our core software products. You work closely together with software engineers and other R&D disciplines in a multidisciplinary way to create awesome products. Our teams are extremely enthusiastic and motivated, so you’ll need to fit seamlessly into that working environment. It is your responsibility to write excellent code, conduct unit tests, and help refine user stories. Finding creative thinking, you’ll deliver a contribution to the solutions we implement in our products.
 Reviewing and testing work from peers Working intensively with your peers Joining the daily stan-dup meetings and demos Create awesome software 
What will your team look like?

You will be working with talented engineers, system testers, UX designers to create the best products. We set the bar high and we want you to help us get there.

What have we worked on recently?
 We released new versions of our printers, firmware and our 3D slicing software (Ultimaker Cura), bringing at a high pace new innovations to our customers. Check our website ultimaker.com for extra details We are busy creating new products that will help our customers get even more out of their printers 
What will your day in the office look like?

During the morning stand-up, you touch base with your team and discuss who will do what and whether anyone needs your help. You’ll work on developing a new feature for a couple of hours and then it’s lunchtime. Over lunch in the canteen, you hear about a cool new 3D model and you think about 3D printing it later at home. After lunch, you have a meeting with a couple of developers to discuss the functionality of a new feature. You extend the automated tests that will be run after this night’s software build. And before you leave home, you review some work from one of your peers.

Do you fit this profile?
 Technical University Master’s degree in in Computer Science, Physics, Data Sciences, Mechatronics, Informatics, or equivalent  Mastering at least two of the following programming languages: Python, QT, C++ and C Mastering how to proper design (embedded) software Affiliation with electronics, mechanics and 3D printing Ability to find innovative solutions if already known solutions are insufficient Ability to deal adequately with unexpected work situations Ability to support improving our agile way of working A proactive, passionate, inventive team player Flexible and quality oriented attitude Capability to zoom out to work under pressure A productive attitude that works toward solutions Very good communication skills in English 
Definitely a plus
 3 years or more relevant working experience at product development working with technical team members from different backgrounds Specific expertise fields: building and debugging hardware abstraction layer for processor boards, Linux device drivers, motion, model driven engineering, real-time software, RTOS, EtherCAT/CAN/… communication protocols Experience with Scrum/agile methodologies Experience with JIRA and GitHub Experience with 3D printing (FDM) Having the potential to grow after some years to an architect, team lead, product owner or product lead role Very good communication skills in Dutch 
The benefits of working with us
 A competitive salary in line with your experience Ultimaker makes contributions to your pension We pay for your daily commute based on public transport 27 days of paid leave per year Use of an Ultimaker 3D printer An open, family atmosphere, and fun work environment Work in a young and energetic team Lunch with healthy sandwiches, salads, and a daily special A convenient location within walking distance of public transport Room to expand your knowledge by following courses and going to meetups A monthly get together with drinks, food, raffles, and fun! 
More detail about Ultimaker

Ultimaker has been in operation since 2011, and over the years has grown to become a market leader, creating powerful, professional, and accessible desktop 3D printers. With offices in the Netherlands, New York, Boston, and Singapore, plus production facilities in both Europe and the US, Ultimaker’s team of more than 400 employees continually strives to accelerate the world’s transition to local digital manufacturing by offering the highest-quality 3D printers, software, and materials on the market.

We offer you the chance to become a part of a young, fast-growing, technically advanced company. We are focused on further developing the Ultimaker, developing the world of 3D printing, and further expanding the skills of our people.

We are ordinary people with extraordinary plans. Creating high-quality products is our driver. Our passion and creativity help us to make the unbelievable believable. Together we make one hell of a team.

Interested?

Interested in working at this young, fast-growing, technically advanced company? Please contact us by sending your motivation letter and résumé (in English) or by phone.

Only candidates eligible to work in the EU will be considered for the position. Unfortunately, given the high volume of applications we receive for our vacancies, these professionals (not entitled to work in the Netherlands) will not be given a status update.

Agency calls will not be appreciated.

Are you a bright Firmware Engineer, with lots of passion for developing products? At Webfleet Solutions we are looking for the best and finest minds in Embedded Software to play a fundamental role in developing ground-breaking technologies in our Amsterdam office.

Here is a little taste of your challenge:
Our software engineers design for quality and reuse, under tight resource-constraints and enjoy being challenged by all kinds of interesting issues – providing the best possible business value in the least amount of time in a future-proof manner and without accumulating technical debt.

Together with your team you develop the next generation of on-board telematic devices.Shaping, analyzing and implementation of new software features in alignment with your stakeholders.Working with your colleagues to develop agreed functional requirements of our high-quality firmware.Being part of a self-organized Scrum team, you improve our development and test strategies as well.

Who are you?

There is no set route to become part of Webfleet Solutions. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind:

Having a degree in computer science, engineering or an equivalent practical qualification, plus 3 to 5 years of experience in embedded software development.It’s in your blood to develop sustainable, maintainable and testable software in C and C++ in an embedded environment.You are curious, eager to get things done and you are driven to further develop yourself.You are a strong communicator with very good written and verbal English skills. Dutch would be a plus!Being a great communicator, analytic, goal-oriented and quality-focused.Having an agile mindset and you like to work with other software engineers across our different locations.Enjoy interacting with other developers, component owners, UX engineers and system engineers. 

What can you expect?

An adventure in software product development within a rapidly growing business unit of a globally renowned brand and various opportunities for your professional development.Being part of a team of professional and passionate developers, contributing to building and adapting the technology for our Webfleet Solutions Service Platform.Brilliant minds. Learn from your colleagues – pioneers and experts who are changing the worldDifferent cultures. Our employees come from all over the world, with 55 nationalities and counting 

Practically Speaking, what's in it for you:

Competitive salaryBenefits package in addition to the salary:
Retirement and disability pensionLife and accident insurance
Flexible holiday planBirthday off!Plenty of formal training for new joiners + access to LinkedIn Learning

Who are we?

Webfleet Solutions is one of the world’s leading telematics solution providers, dedicated to fleet management, vehicle telematics and connected car services. Its main Software-as-a-Service solution WEBFLEET is used by businesses of all sizes to improve vehicle performance, save fuel, support drivers and increase overall fleet efficiency. In addition, Webfleet Solutions provides services for the insurance, rental and leasing industries, car importers and companies that address the needs of businesses as well as consumers. Webfleet Solutions has over 50,000 customers worldwide and services drivers in more than 100 countries, giving them the industry’s strongest local support network and widest range of sector-specific third-party applications and integrations. Our customers benefit every day from the high standards of confidentiality, integrity and availability of our ISO/IEC 27001:2013 certified service, re-audited in November 2018.

Webfleet Solutions is part of Bridgestone Europe NV/SA (“Bridgestone”), a subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, a leader in advanced solutions and sustainable mobility.

For further information, please visit webfleet.com. Follow us on Twitter @WebfleetNews. For more information about Bridgestone in EMIA, please visit www.bridgestone-emia.com and Bridgestone newsroom.

Want to join us?

If that’s a yes, then please apply to say hi. Complete the online form and attachments in English, please. You can also send your CV and the reference of the position you are applying to us in an email to ana.delacruz@webfleet.com.
Do note that online technical evaluation and pre-employment screening are part of the selection process.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

The world of banking is changing faster than ever, enjoy the best experience in our IT traineeship During our two-year programme, you create your own career within Information Technology. You learn more about your chosen discipline and about the complex IT environment within ING. you to discover yourself through a wide selection of (online) professional and personal skills trainings. Make an impact as a trainee At ING we are always broadening our horizons. Our people have a forward-thinking mentality, a strong can-do spirit and enjoy working in an agile environment. Do you want to have an impact on not only the financial lives of close to 8 million customers but also on the bank of the future? Why wait, discover how today. As an IT trainee you can choose from a number of important IT projects, within which you will make a significant contribution. Now more than ever, IT is the beating heart of ING. Terms such as artificial intelligence, fintech, blockchain, cloud, continuous delivery, API and full stack and have become part of the bank’s standard vocabulary with good reason. We have 6,6 million customers who make use of online banking, and our mobile app is among the top ten most popular apps. All departments within our organization, such as the dealing room, work with state-of-the-art software which we develop in-house. Your first year ING takes a customer-centric approach and IT plays a crucial role in that, which is why we are looking for trainees with a real passion for IT. Your trainee manager will assist you in choosing your first rotation which lasts approximately six months. Based on your own interests, you can indicate your preferences so that we can work together to find a suitable starting role for you. You could set to work as DevOps Engineer, IT Security Engineer, Architect, Java Developer or in the area of Cyber security, for example. As a trainee you will also receive guidance from your line manager. If you are looking for additional guidance you can ask a Senior Manager to mentor you. They will coach you, inspire you, introduce you to their network and share their knowledge and insights with you. You are in charge of your second assignment. Now it comes down to addressing your network and taking the initiative. We encourage it to gain international experience during this six-month period, which is not only great fun but is also good for your personal and professional development, if possible with local Covid-19 restrictions. Your benefits Besides being given the opportunity to put your talent to good use where it really matters, you’ll participate in a global training event with all trainees from your year, which will also enable you to quickly build up a large network. There is more, to give you an idea, we will tell you about the other benefits of working at ING: Excellent base salary; 13th month salary; 8% Holiday payment; 216 hours of holiday per year based on a 40 hour working week; Laptop and budget to purchase a (work) phone; NS business card or travel allowance; Impressive training package; Permanent contract. Our IT trainee Has a master’s degree from a university, preferably in Computer Science, Informatics, Software/Computer Engineering or Mathematics (with clear programming affinity). Has a demonstrable and indomitable passion for IT. Is enthusiastic and consider the interests of our customers and your colleagues. Has an innovative take on banking and an unconditional drive to turn your ideas into reality. Has have an interest to learn more about banking/finance Do you have what it takes? When applying for the IT traineeship October 2021, remember to upload your complete application: CV, motivational questions and grade lists (Bachelor and Master till now) in English. if you are sure you are what we are looking for, go for it! The first interview round (HR interview) will be scheduled as soon as you pass the three part assessment. We have a limited amount of traineeship positions per traineeship, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible! Click on the following links to find out more about the ITP Programme and the selection procedure. Please note that the results will remain definite for a future application for one of our traineeships. This means that you cannot apply again after not passing either our assessment or interview stage.

The eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative global leader in online classifieds. Our sites help people find whatever they need in their local communities. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. We have eleven brands that span the globe offering online classifieds in more than 1,000 cities. Our strong local presence is backed up by a suite of global capabilities, built and maintained by central product and development teams collocated in offices. We are growing these teams with a focus on our Headquarters in Amsterdam.
We believe that solving customer problems and delivering value to our business can be done at scale. As the Global Capabilities Team (CAPS) we offer our local brands a portfolio of capabilities along the end customer journey that speeds up time to market across the eBay Classifieds Group. Our global teams develop and innovate a broad variety of central solutions and services: Full integrations of back-office systems, central advertising, experimentation and real-time communication solutions, personalisation and performance APIs and algorithms as well as a central data infrastructure. We closely partner with our local peers on efficient integrations of our capabilities that create valuable experiences for our end customers and the business. We are a diverse and highly motivated team. Data is the voice of our customers and helps us to define the common goals we work towards as one team.
Being part of the Core Chat team, you will play a crucial role in providing messaging solutions for millions of buyers and sellers in 12 different markets worldwide. On a daily basis, we process over 20 million messages. Not only is the Core Chat team responsible for making sure that these messages are delivered fast and reliable, also prevention of spam, fraud and other bad behavior is part of our responsibility. Making sure that we come up with ideas and solutions to help improve the trading experience on the platforms is another part of our mission. We are looking for you as a: 
Java Backend Engineer (m/f)    
Your tasks and responsibilities: 
Work with your development lead, other developers, product managers, QA, and operation teams to develop solutions that meet the service requirements and deliver good performance, scalability, and reliability Tackle real-world technical and scaling issues on a regular basis Initiate design discussions, present potential solutions to your peers, and understand the true costs and benefits of technologies you introduce Implement a sophisticated, distributed and highly available communication service in a robust team Rebuild existing platform using cloud technologies Collaborate with other team members and engineers Estimate your development efforts, plan implementations, and rollout system changes within an agile/lean environment 
Your profile: 
Passion for agile software development and continuous deployment in an autonomous environment 3+ years’ experience in requirements analysis, design, coding and unit testing of scalable, distributed, fault-tolerant applications for the Internet Several years of experience with JVM-based languages and Linux-based systems Solid understanding of distributed, NoSQL databases such as Cassandra Experience with public cloud platforms (specifically Google Cloud Platform) or big-data platforms is a big plusFamiliarity with distributed computing and storage systems, and modern CI/CD approaches A flexible approach, balanced by solid experience in building a scalable service, is paramountInsight to see the need for changing priorities when the situation requires it and act on it An innovative attitude who can visualize/evangelize within the team about the strengths of your approach and carry your team members with you High aspiration for quality balanced with a good sense of pragmatism Effective oral and written English communication skills  What we offer: A family friendly company Excellent workplace in Amsterdam High team autonomy and agile environment 
Looking to leave your footprint in global e-commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, and share anything around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven team that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join the eBay Classifieds Group.

Highlights– Salaris tot €4.000 en direct een vast contract;– Opleiding op het gebied van Siemens of SCADA;– Nuchtere en directe sfeer in het bedrijf.
Wat ga jij doenAls Software Engineer ondersteun je de Lead Engineer bij het inventariseren van de wensen van klanten. Je ontwikkelt samen met een multidisciplinair team hoogwaardige besturingstechniek.
Jouw verantwoordelijkheden– Als Software Engineer maak je het functioneel ontwerp aan de hand van klantspecificaties en systeemdefinities;– Je realiseert de software in TIA Portal van Siemens;– Je zorgt als Software Engineer voor de ontwikkeling van SCADA;– Je onderhoudt contact met klanten over de projectvoortgang;– Je verricht als Software Engineer de inbedrijfstelling on-site;– Je werkt nauw samen met andere disciplines (Hardware & Process Engineering).
Wat wij zoeken– MBO/HBO afgestudeerd Elektrotechniek, Industriële Automatisering of Mechatronica;– 4 tot 8 jaar werkervaring als Software Engineer met besturingstechniek (PLC/SCADA);– Ervaring met Siemens TIA Portal is een pré;– Je bent klantgericht en hebt goede commerciële vaardigheden;– Je bent resultaatgericht, flexibel, stressbestendig en nauwkeurig;– Je bent communicatief vaardig en hebt ambitie.

Er werken veel gedreven Engineers, die samen technisch hoogwaardige kwaliteit afleveren. Medewerkers staan binnen deze organisatie. Doorgroeien en je verder ontwikkelen wordt gestimuleerd.

Company Description
 
Turnitin is a global company dedicated to ensuring the integrity of education and meaningfully improving learning outcomes. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Our products are used by educators to guide their students towards higher standards of integrity and by students, researchers and professionals to do their best, original work. 

Turnitin has offices in Australia, India, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Over 15,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Feedback Studio, Gradescope, iThenticate, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity and ExamSoft


Job Description

You will join our growing technical department and you’ll help shape and develop a more mature team. You'll be surrounded by talented professionals. Some are passionate about honing their craft and applying it to delivering world-class experiences. Others are equally passionate about developing high performing teams in tandem with deliverables. Both are critical. We wear many hats and roll up our sleeves. We collaborate and help each other. We do what needs to get done to deliver on our commitments and deliver amazing products to our customers and users.
Work closely with other development team members to understand all features and how to best integrate testing workflows.Help product managers identifying and setting requirements for all possible user flows, including the ability to translate SLA requirements into technical requirements that can be tested.Contributing to the architectural designs made by the team, ensuring they take into account testing requirements.Help implement the CI/CD/CD pipeline.Complement the whole team, as well as the development team, to improve bug management and bug visibilityOperate in an Agile development environment while collaborating with key stakeholdersResolve complex technical issues as necessaryKeep abreast of new technology developments
 

Qualifications
Experience with Agile software development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban,...)Experience with web application quality assuranceExperience with test automation planning, setup and reportingSome experience with load testing planning, execution and reportingSome experience with CI/CD/CD processes and toolsSome experience with containerised applications and distributed systemsAn innovative mindset, with the capability to think outside-of-the-boxA pragmatic mindset, with the ability of quickly applying out-of-the-box solutionsUnderstanding of the difference between out-of-the-box and outside-of-the-boxUnderstanding in industry best practices in quality managementAbility to work well in a team, willingness to help others, to give and receive feedback and compromise when neededStrong analytical capacityExcellent communications skills
 

Additional Information

Graduate, Software Developer
As a Graduate, Software Developer you will rotate around various projects which directly contribute towards the products we create for our customers. You will be accountable for supporting and contributing to all aspects of delivery lifecycle - this means you will be working on real world challenges.

Reporting to the Software Development Lead, you will be a part of the Product Engineering team responsible for delivering the highest quality Products to the Business within the wider SITA organization.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

What You Will Do
 Gathering requirements, developing, and testing software on customer facing projects. Operate in a DevOps environment contributing to all aspects of the delivery lifecycle. Write and deliver code for components under the guidance of more experienced Developers. Write Automate Test cases for Continuous testing of the products. Design and influence direction of future solutions. Develop an understanding of coding guidelines and best practice. Learn requirement analysis and design techniques. Work with a dynamic team who leverage their technical expertise to develop cloud hosted components through to hardware drivers to provide an end to end product solution.
Who You Are
 Must have a Degree at Hons level in an IT/Engineering discipline; Must obtain your degree by July 2021. Must have less than 12 months’ post graduate experience, excluding undergraduate placement/ internship experience. Must be eligible to work in the United Kingdom without the need for a work permit / sponsorship Experience in any software programming language. Experience creating a potential solution to a problem. i.e. Design Thinking or Prototyping.
What You Can Expect
 Participate in structured rotations allowing you great exposure to different teams and technologies. Get assigned to a Buddy and a Mentor that will guide you throughout your Graduate experience. Be a part of a Graduate community – both local and global. Have access to both Technical and soft skills development training.
What We Offer

SITA’s workplace is all about diversity many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.
 And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, bonus, flexible benefits, medical policy, pension plan and access to world class learning. Receive a competitive salary on top of the extensive benefits package.
 Welcome to SITA 
SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.
We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Are you ready to explore the opportunities?

We believe that “through sports we have the power to change lives,” and we’re doing it every single day. adidas is one of the largest direct-to-consumer ecommerce companies in the world, and we happily take on the challenge of delighting billions of visitors.

As individuals: we’re confident and creative. As a team: we’re collaborative and greater than the sum of our parts. We deeply value diversity and inclusion because we cherish each of our teammates and the breadth of perspectives they bring to the table. “Digital is a team sport,” and it takes the entire team to create the online store for the best sports brand in the world.

What will I do?

 Write code to increase visibility and traffic to adidas and Reebok online stores used around the world Script automated tests, just as important as the previous point Attend and sometimes lead Scrum ceremonies, including daily standups, refinements, retrospectives and demos  Collaborate closely with product owners and solution architects to increase both quality and quantity of traffic to our sites from search engines Maintain existing code by fixing bugs and refactoring problem areas Adopt team-wide coding standards and follow best practices Invest time in personal growth and development by using online resources and receiving coaching from senior engineers Release software efficiently to production multiple times per day 

What’s the tech stack like?

We use very modern technologies and methodologies to prioritize developer experience and productivity while enabling us to produce fantastic results for our consumers. And we’re always open to new ideas and improvements.

We write our applications in TypeScript using open-source tools like React, Redux and Node.js. And we ensure the quality of our code meets our demanding standards by performing automated testing with Jest, Cypress and Selenium.

Finally, all of our wonderful code is compiled and packaged up into Docker images by Jenkins CI/CD pipelines and deployed to our high availability Kubernetes clusters.

From us, you will get

 Choice between MacBook Pro and Windows laptops Mobile smartphone Flexibility to work from home or the newly renovated Amsterdam headquarters (when restrictions are lifted) Part-time contract is possible if full-time isn’t for you 28 days of personal time off (PTO) Online and offline education resources, like Udemy and LinkedIn Learning On-site gym Employee discount on adidas and Reebok Collective insurance discount Commuter benefits Discounted lunch at the office 

Is this job for me?

Are you excited about the latest technologies? How about applying them at global scales?

Are you genuinely passionate about producing high-quality, consumer-facing applications and proud to share your hard work with family and friends?

Come be a part of our team of hands-on engineers who believe in testing and automating everything. We’re constantly learning, ever growing and always eager to do things better.

What if I don’t check all the boxes?

It’s ok if some of the technology or terminology mentioned here are new for you. We’ll happily teach you.

At adidas, we’re keen to increase our team’s diversity of backgrounds and skills, and we’re more interested in the work you will produce than that work you’ve already produced in the past. If you’d love to work with us, then we’d love to hear from you.

Je bent (bijna) in het bezit van een hbo of wo diploma en wil graag aan de slag binnen de IT, maar merkt dat de aansluiting op een specifieke baan nog beter zou kunnen. Je bent op zoek naar een IT-traineeship die jou de juiste tooling biedt en zorgt voor een vliegende start van jouw carrière! Nu nog één vinden die aan jouw wensen voldoet! Benieuwd of dat het traineeship van Working Talent is? Lees dan snel verder!
Hoe ziet het traineeship er uit?Op 29 maart 2021 gaat er weer een nieuw IT-traineeship van start. Dit traineeship bestaat uit 3 fases.
In fase 1 en 2 volg jij een intensief IT-bootcamp, dat bestaat uit klassikale trainingen en online zelfstudie. In fase 1 leg jij de basis van jouw IT-carrière. Je gaat gedurende 4 weken aan de slag met fundamentele IT-onderwerpen zoals Agile & Scrum, networking, architectuur, security, modelleren, coderen, databases en cloud. In fase 2, die 6 weken duurt, ga je een specialisatie doen. Er zijn 4 uitstroomrichtingen: Data Analytics, DevOps Cloud, Software Development en Business & IT. Samen besluiten wij welke specialisatie jij gaat doen.
In fase 3 ga jij aan de slag bij een van onze opdrachtgevers. Je stroomt in als trainee en wordt vanaf de start goed begeleid door collega’s, teamleden en Working Talent. Het uitgangspunt is dat je na ongeveer 1,5 jaar in dienst treedt bij jouw opdrachtgever.

Dit bieden wij jouEen leerzaam en innovatief IT-traineeship waarin je leert werken met de nieuwste technieken die aansluiten bij de actualiteiten in de marktDiverse erkende certificatenGoede begeleiding door Working TalentEen startsalaris van € 2600 bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur, vanaf de eerste werkdag bij de opdrachtgeverEen startbonus van € 1400 bruto, na drie gewerkte maanden bij de opdrachtgever Deze vacature staat uit in meerdere regio's. As an ambitious and technically focused company, we keep moving forward with innovation. We are looking for sharp minded and talented engineers who can help our R&D teams reach the next level, creating more and even better quality products.

Our new team members should have a very technical background.

Are you up for the challenge? Then, keep reading.

What will you be doing?

This Includes

As a Software Engineer, you will be working on one or more of our core software products. You work closely together with software engineers and other R&D disciplines in a multidisciplinary way to create awesome products. Our teams are extremely enthusiastic and motivated, so you’ll need to fit seamlessly into that working environment. It is your responsibility to write excellent code, conduct unit tests, and help refine user stories. Finding creative thinking, you’ll deliver a contribution to the solutions we implement in our products.
 Reviewing and testing work from peers Working intensively with your peers Joining the daily stan-dup meetings and demos Create awesome software 
What will your team look like?

You will be working with talented engineers, system testers, UX designers to create the best products. We set the bar high and we want you to help us get there.

What have we worked on recently?
 We released new versions of our printers, firmware and our 3D slicing software (Ultimaker Cura), bringing at a high pace new innovations to our customers. Check our website ultimaker.com for extra details We are busy creating new products that will help our customers get even more out of their printers 
What will your day in the office look like?

During the morning stand-up, you touch base with your team and discuss who will do what and whether anyone needs your help. You’ll work on developing a new feature for a couple of hours and then it’s lunchtime. Over lunch in the canteen, you hear about a cool new 3D model and you think about 3D printing it later at home. After lunch, you have a meeting with a couple of developers to discuss the functionality of a new feature. You extend the automated tests that will be run after this night’s software build. And before you leave home, you review some work from one of your peers.

Do you fit this profile?
 Technical University Master’s degree in in Computer Science, Physics, Data Sciences, Mechatronics, Informatics, or equivalent  Mastering at least two of the following programming languages: Python, QT, C++ and C Mastering how to proper design (embedded) software Affiliation with electronics, mechanics and 3D printing Ability to find innovative solutions if already known solutions are insufficient Ability to deal adequately with unexpected work situations Ability to support improving our agile way of working A proactive, passionate, inventive team player Flexible and quality oriented attitude Capability to zoom out to work under pressure A productive attitude that works toward solutions Very good communication skills in English 
Definitely a plus
 3 years or more relevant working experience at product development working with technical team members from different backgrounds Specific expertise fields: building and debugging hardware abstraction layer for processor boards, Linux device drivers, motion, model driven engineering, real-time software, RTOS, EtherCAT/CAN/… communication protocols Experience with Scrum/agile methodologies Experience with JIRA and GitHub Experience with 3D printing (FDM) Having the potential to grow after some years to an architect, team lead, product owner or product lead role Very good communication skills in Dutch 
The benefits of working with us
 A competitive salary in line with your experience Ultimaker makes contributions to your pension We pay for your daily commute based on public transport 27 days of paid leave per year Use of an Ultimaker 3D printer An open, family atmosphere, and fun work environment Work in a young and energetic team Lunch with healthy sandwiches, salads, and a daily special A convenient location within walking distance of public transport Room to expand your knowledge by following courses and going to meetups A monthly get together with drinks, food, raffles, and fun! 
More detail about Ultimaker

Ultimaker has been in operation since 2011, and over the years has grown to become a market leader, creating powerful, professional, and accessible desktop 3D printers. With offices in the Netherlands, New York, Boston, and Singapore, plus production facilities in both Europe and the US, Ultimaker’s team of more than 400 employees continually strives to accelerate the world’s transition to local digital manufacturing by offering the highest-quality 3D printers, software, and materials on the market.

We offer you the chance to become a part of a young, fast-growing, technically advanced company. We are focused on further developing the Ultimaker, developing the world of 3D printing, and further expanding the skills of our people.

We are ordinary people with extraordinary plans. Creating high-quality products is our driver. Our passion and creativity help us to make the unbelievable believable. Together we make one hell of a team.

Interested?

Interested in working at this young, fast-growing, technically advanced company? Please contact us by sending your motivation letter and résumé (in English) or by phone.

Only candidates eligible to work in the EU will be considered for the position. Unfortunately, given the high volume of applications we receive for our vacancies, these professionals (not entitled to work in the Netherlands) will not be given a status update.

Agency calls will not be appreciated.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

What You Will Do
 Gathering requirements, developing, and testing software on customer facing projects. Operate in a DevOps environment contributing to all aspects of the delivery lifecycle. Write and deliver code for components under the guidance of more experienced Developers. Write Automate Test cases for Continuous testing of the products. Design and influence direction of future solutions. Develop an understanding of coding guidelines and best practice. Learn requirement analysis and design techniques. Work with a dynamic team who leverage their technical expertise to develop cloud hosted components through to hardware drivers to provide an end to end product solution.
Who You Are
 Must have a Degree at Hons level in an IT/Engineering discipline; Must obtain your degree by July 2021. Must have less than 12 months’ post graduate experience, excluding undergraduate placement/ internship experience. Must be eligible to work in the United Kingdom without the need for a work permit / sponsorship Experience in any software programming language. Experience creating a potential solution to a problem. i.e. Design Thinking or Prototyping.
What You Can Expect
 Participate in structured rotations allowing you great exposure to different teams and technologies. Get assigned to a Buddy and a Mentor that will guide you throughout your Graduate experience. Be a part of a Graduate community – both local and global. Have access to both Technical and soft skills development training.
What We Offer

SITA’s workplace is all about diversity many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.
 And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, bonus, flexible benefits, medical policy, pension plan and access to world class learning. Receive a competitive salary on top of the extensive benefits package.
 Welcome to SITA 
SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.
We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. We believe that “through sports we have the power to change lives,” and we’re doing it every single day. adidas is one of the largest direct-to-consumer ecommerce companies in the world, and we happily take on the challenge of delighting billions of visitors.

As individuals: we’re confident and creative. As a team: we’re collaborative and greater than the sum of our parts. We deeply value diversity and inclusion because we cherish each of our teammates and the breadth of perspectives they bring to the table. “Digital is a team sport,” and it takes the entire team to create the online store for the best sports brand in the world.

What will I do?

 Write code to increase visibility and traffic to adidas and Reebok online stores used around the world Script automated tests, just as important as the previous point Attend and sometimes lead Scrum ceremonies, including daily standups, refinements, retrospectives and demos  Collaborate closely with product owners and solution architects to increase both quality and quantity of traffic to our sites from search engines Maintain existing code by fixing bugs and refactoring problem areas Adopt team-wide coding standards and follow best practices Invest time in personal growth and development by using online resources and receiving coaching from senior engineers Release software efficiently to production multiple times per day 

What’s the tech stack like?

We use very modern technologies and methodologies to prioritize developer experience and productivity while enabling us to produce fantastic results for our consumers. And we’re always open to new ideas and improvements.

We write our applications in TypeScript using open-source tools like React, Redux and Node.js. And we ensure the quality of our code meets our demanding standards by performing automated testing with Jest, Cypress and Selenium.

Finally, all of our wonderful code is compiled and packaged up into Docker images by Jenkins CI/CD pipelines and deployed to our high availability Kubernetes clusters.

From us, you will get

 Choice between MacBook Pro and Windows laptops Mobile smartphone Flexibility to work from home or the newly renovated Amsterdam headquarters (when restrictions are lifted) Part-time contract is possible if full-time isn’t for you 28 days of personal time off (PTO) Online and offline education resources, like Udemy and LinkedIn Learning On-site gym Employee discount on adidas and Reebok Collective insurance discount Commuter benefits Discounted lunch at the office 

Is this job for me?

Are you excited about the latest technologies? How about applying them at global scales?

Are you genuinely passionate about producing high-quality, consumer-facing applications and proud to share your hard work with family and friends?

Come be a part of our team of hands-on engineers who believe in testing and automating everything. We’re constantly learning, ever growing and always eager to do things better.

What if I don’t check all the boxes?

It’s ok if some of the technology or terminology mentioned here are new for you. We’ll happily teach you.

At adidas, we’re keen to increase our team’s diversity of backgrounds and skills, and we’re more interested in the work you will produce than that work you’ve already produced in the past. If you’d love to work with us, then we’d love to hear from you.

Je bent (bijna) in het bezit van een hbo of wo diploma en wil graag aan de slag binnen de IT, maar merkt dat de aansluiting op een specifieke baan nog beter zou kunnen. Je bent op zoek naar een IT-traineeship die jou de juiste tooling biedt en zorgt voor een vliegende start van jouw carrière! Nu nog één vinden die aan jouw wensen voldoet! Benieuwd of dat het traineeship van Working Talent is? Lees dan snel verder!
Hoe ziet het traineeship er uit?Op 29 maart 2021 gaat er weer een nieuw IT-traineeship van start. Dit traineeship bestaat uit 3 fases.
In fase 1 en 2 volg jij een intensief IT-bootcamp, dat bestaat uit klassikale trainingen en online zelfstudie. In fase 1 leg jij de basis van jouw IT-carrière. Je gaat gedurende 4 weken aan de slag met fundamentele IT-onderwerpen zoals Agile & Scrum, networking, architectuur, security, modelleren, coderen, databases en cloud. In fase 2, die 6 weken duurt, ga je een specialisatie doen. Er zijn 4 uitstroomrichtingen: Data Analytics, DevOps Cloud, Software Development en Business & IT. Samen besluiten wij welke specialisatie jij gaat doen.
In fase 3 ga jij aan de slag bij een van onze opdrachtgevers. Je stroomt in als trainee en wordt vanaf de start goed begeleid door collega’s, teamleden en Working Talent. Het uitgangspunt is dat je na ongeveer 1,5 jaar in dienst treedt bij jouw opdrachtgever.
Dit vragen wij van jouEen afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding (een IT- of bèta studie is een pré)Je bent initiatiefrijk, communicatief vaardig, analytisch en flexibel ingesteldJe hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met IT, bijvoorbeeld doordat je enige ervaring hebt met programmeren of het bouwen van je eigen website (zelfstudie inbegrepen).Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift
Dit bieden wij jouEen leerzaam en innovatief IT-traineeship waarin je leert werken met de nieuwste technieken die aansluiten bij de actualiteiten in de marktDiverse erkende certificatenGoede begeleiding door Working TalentEen startsalaris van € 2600 bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur, vanaf de eerste werkdag bij de opdrachtgeverEen startbonus van € 1400 bruto, na drie gewerkte maanden bij de opdrachtgever Deze vacature staat uit in meerdere regio's. Bekijk de andere vacatures of neem contact met ons op voor de mogelijkheden. Is dit traineeship echt iets voor jou? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw sollicitatie!

As an ambitious and technically focused company, we keep moving forward with innovation. We are looking for sharp minded and talented engineers who can help our R&D teams reach the next level, creating more and even better quality products.

Our new team members should have a very technical background.

Are you up for the challenge? Then, keep reading.

What will you be doing?

This Includes

As a Software Engineer, you will be working on one or more of our core software products. You work closely together with software engineers and other R&D disciplines in a multidisciplinary way to create awesome products. Our teams are extremely enthusiastic and motivated, so you’ll need to fit seamlessly into that working environment. It is your responsibility to write excellent code, conduct unit tests, and help refine user stories. Finding creative thinking, you’ll deliver a contribution to the solutions we implement in our products.
 Reviewing and testing work from peers Working intensively with your peers Joining the daily stan-dup meetings and demos Create awesome software 
What will your team look like?

You will be working with talented engineers, system testers, UX designers to create the best products. We set the bar high and we want you to help us get there.

What have we worked on recently?
 We released new versions of our printers, firmware and our 3D slicing software (Ultimaker Cura), bringing at a high pace new innovations to our customers. Check our website ultimaker.com for extra details We are busy creating new products that will help our customers get even more out of their printers 
What will your day in the office look like?

During the morning stand-up, you touch base with your team and discuss who will do what and whether anyone needs your help. You’ll work on developing a new feature for a couple of hours and then it’s lunchtime. Over lunch in the canteen, you hear about a cool new 3D model and you think about 3D printing it later at home. After lunch, you have a meeting with a couple of developers to discuss the functionality of a new feature. You extend the automated tests that will be run after this night’s software build. And before you leave home, you review some work from one of your peers.

Do you fit this profile?
 Technical University Master’s degree in in Computer Science, Physics, Data Sciences, Mechatronics, Informatics, or equivalent  Mastering at least two of the following programming languages: Python, QT, C++ and C Mastering how to proper design (embedded) software Affiliation with electronics, mechanics and 3D printing Ability to find innovative solutions if already known solutions are insufficient Ability to deal adequately with unexpected work situations Ability to support improving our agile way of working A proactive, passionate, inventive team player Flexible and quality oriented attitude Capability to zoom out to work under pressure A productive attitude that works toward solutions Very good communication skills in English 
Definitely a plus
 3 years or more relevant working experience at product development working with technical team members from different backgrounds Specific expertise fields: building and debugging hardware abstraction layer for processor boards, Linux device drivers, motion, model driven engineering, real-time software, RTOS, EtherCAT/CAN/… communication protocols Experience with Scrum/agile methodologies Experience with JIRA and GitHub Experience with 3D printing (FDM) Having the potential to grow after some years to an architect, team lead, product owner or product lead role Very good communication skills in Dutch 
The benefits of working with us
 A competitive salary in line with your experience Ultimaker makes contributions to your pension We pay for your daily commute based on public transport 27 days of paid leave per year Use of an Ultimaker 3D printer An open, family atmosphere, and fun work environment Work in a young and energetic team Lunch with healthy sandwiches, salads, and a daily special A convenient location within walking distance of public transport Room to expand your knowledge by following courses and going to meetups A monthly get together with drinks, food, raffles, and fun! 
More detail about Ultimaker

Ultimaker has been in operation since 2011, and over the years has grown to become a market leader, creating powerful, professional, and accessible desktop 3D printers. With offices in the Netherlands, New York, Boston, and Singapore, plus production facilities in both Europe and the US, Ultimaker’s team of more than 400 employees continually strives to accelerate the world’s transition to local digital manufacturing by offering the highest-quality 3D printers, software, and materials on the market.

We offer you the chance to become a part of a young, fast-growing, technically advanced company. We are focused on further developing the Ultimaker, developing the world of 3D printing, and further expanding the skills of our people.

We are ordinary people with extraordinary plans. Creating high-quality products is our driver. Our passion and creativity help us to make the unbelievable believable. Together we make one hell of a team.

Interested?

Interested in working at this young, fast-growing, technically advanced company? Please contact us by sending your motivation letter and résumé (in English) or by phone.

Only candidates eligible to work in the EU will be considered for the position. Unfortunately, given the high volume of applications we receive for our vacancies, these professionals (not entitled to work in the Netherlands) will not be given a status update.

Agency calls will not be appreciated.

Webfleet Solutions is one of the world’s leading telematics solution providers, dedicated to fleet management, vehicle telematics and connected car services. Its main Software-as-a-Service solution WEBFLEET is used by businesses of all sizes to improve vehicle performance, save fuel, support drivers and increase overall fleet efficiency. If that’s a yes, then please apply to say hi. Complete the online form and attachments in English, please. You can also send your CV and the reference of the position you are applying to us in an email to ana.delacruz@webfleet.com.

Has an innovative take on banking and an unconditional drive to turn your ideas into reality. Has have an interest to learn more about banking/finance Do you have what it takes? We are growing these teams with a focus on our Headquarters in Amsterdam.

Our global teams develop and innovate a broad variety of central solutions and services: Full integrations of back-office systems, central advertising, experimentation and real-time communication solutions, personalisation and performance APIs and algorithms as well as a central data infrastructure. We closely partner with our local peers on efficient integrations of our capabilities that create valuable experiences for our end customers and the business. Java Backend Engineer (m/f)

Your profile: 
Passion for agile software development and continuous deployment in an autonomous environment 3+ years’ experience in requirements analysis, design, coding and unit testing of scalable, distributed, fault-tolerant applications for the Internet Several years of experience with JVM-based languages and Linux-based systems Solid understanding of distributed, NoSQL databases such as Cassandra Experience with public cloud platforms (specifically Google Cloud Platform) or big-data platforms is a big plusFamiliarity with distributed computing and storage systems, and modern CI/CD approaches A flexible approach, balanced by solid experience in building a scalable service, is paramountInsight to see the need for changing priorities when the situation requires it and act on it An innovative attitude who can visualize/evangelize within the team about the strengths of your approach and carry your team members with you High aspiration for quality balanced with a good sense of pragmatism Effective oral and written English communication skills  What we offer: A family friendly company Excellent workplace in Amsterdam High team autonomy and agile environment

We believe that “through sports we have the power to change lives,” and we’re doing it every single day. adidas is one of the largest direct-to-consumer ecommerce companies in the world, and we happily take on the challenge of delighting billions of visitors.

As individuals: we’re confident and creative. As a team: we’re collaborative and greater than the sum of our parts. We deeply value diversity and inclusion because we cherish each of our teammates and the breadth of perspectives they bring to the table. “Digital is a team sport,” and it takes the entire team to create the online store for the best sports brand in the world.

What will I do?

 Write code to increase visibility and traffic to adidas and Reebok online stores used around the world Script automated tests, just as important as the previous point Attend and sometimes lead Scrum ceremonies, including daily standups, refinements, retrospectives and demos  Collaborate closely with product owners and solution architects to increase both quality and quantity of traffic to our sites from search engines Maintain existing code by fixing bugs and refactoring problem areas Adopt team-wide coding standards and follow best practices Invest time in personal growth and development by using online resources and receiving coaching from senior engineers Release software efficiently to production multiple times per day 

What’s the tech stack like?

We use very modern technologies and methodologies to prioritize developer experience and productivity while enabling us to produce fantastic results for our consumers. And we’re always open to new ideas and improvements.

We write our applications in TypeScript using open-source tools like React, Redux and Node.js. And we ensure the quality of our code meets our demanding standards by performing automated testing with Jest, Cypress and Selenium.

Finally, all of our wonderful code is compiled and packaged up into Docker images by Jenkins CI/CD pipelines and deployed to our high availability Kubernetes clusters.

From us, you will get

 Choice between MacBook Pro and Windows laptops Mobile smartphone Flexibility to work from home or the newly renovated Amsterdam headquarters (when restrictions are lifted) Part-time contract is possible if full-time isn’t for you 28 days of personal time off (PTO) Online and offline education resources, like Udemy and LinkedIn Learning On-site gym Employee discount on adidas and Reebok Collective insurance discount Commuter benefits Discounted lunch at the office 

Is this job for me?

Are you excited about the latest technologies? How about applying them at global scales?

Are you genuinely passionate about producing high-quality, consumer-facing applications and proud to share your hard work with family and friends?

Come be a part of our team of hands-on engineers who believe in testing and automating everything. We’re constantly learning, ever growing and always eager to do things better.

What if I don’t check all the boxes?

It’s ok if some of the technology or terminology mentioned here are new for you. We’ll happily teach you.

At adidas, we’re keen to increase our team’s diversity of backgrounds and skills, and we’re more interested in the work you will produce than that work you’ve already produced in the past. If you’d love to work with us, then we’d love to hear from you.

Je bent (bijna) in het bezit van een hbo of wo diploma en wil graag aan de slag binnen de IT, maar merkt dat de aansluiting op een specifieke baan nog beter zou kunnen. Je bent op zoek naar een IT-traineeship die jou de juiste tooling biedt en zorgt voor een vliegende start van jouw carrière! Nu nog één vinden die aan jouw wensen voldoet! Benieuwd of dat het traineeship van Working Talent is? Lees dan snel verder!
Hoe ziet het traineeship er uit?Op 29 maart 2021 gaat er weer een nieuw IT-traineeship van start. Dit traineeship bestaat uit 3 fases.
In fase 1 en 2 volg jij een intensief IT-bootcamp, dat bestaat uit klassikale trainingen en online zelfstudie. In fase 1 leg jij de basis van jouw IT-carrière. Je gaat gedurende 4 weken aan de slag met fundamentele IT-onderwerpen zoals Agile & Scrum, networking, architectuur, security, modelleren, coderen, databases en cloud. In fase 2, die 6 weken duurt, ga je een specialisatie doen. Er zijn 4 uitstroomrichtingen: Data Analytics, DevOps Cloud, Software Development en Business & IT. Samen besluiten wij welke specialisatie jij gaat doen.
In fase 3 ga jij aan de slag bij een van onze opdrachtgevers. Je stroomt in als trainee en wordt vanaf de start goed begeleid door collega’s, teamleden en Working Talent. Het uitgangspunt is dat je na ongeveer 1,5 jaar in dienst treedt bij jouw opdrachtgever.
Dit vragen wij van jouEen afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding (een IT- of bèta studie is een pré)Je bent initiatiefrijk, communicatief vaardig, analytisch en flexibel ingesteldJe hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met IT, bijvoorbeeld doordat je enige ervaring hebt met programmeren of het bouwen van je eigen website (zelfstudie inbegrepen).Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift
Dit bieden wij jouEen leerzaam en innovatief IT-traineeship waarin je leert werken met de nieuwste technieken die aansluiten bij de actualiteiten in de marktDiverse erkende certificatenGoede begeleiding door Working TalentEen startsalaris van € 2600 bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur, vanaf de eerste werkdag bij de opdrachtgeverEen startbonus van € 1400 bruto, na drie gewerkte maanden bij de opdrachtgever Deze vacature staat uit in meerdere regio's. Bekijk de andere vacatures of neem contact met ons op voor de mogelijkheden. Is dit traineeship echt iets voor jou? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw sollicitatie!
Voor vragen kun je kun je contact opnemen met één van onze recruiters via 085-0608506 of solliciteren@workingtalent.nl.
